title: June update

articleSections.copy:
Everything has been crazy with Fi’s new album - which is going down a storm! Incredible reviews coming in from all over the world - all available here: http://www.fionaross.co.uk/press

Some highlights include:

  • "Fiona reaches into another stratosphere" - Music Interview Magazine

  • "Technical virtuosity and that raw emotional drive, of an artist at the height of her game" - Jazz Quarterly

  • "Fierce and Non-Compliant, and honest and true and oh so very talented" - Maxine Gordon

  • "Ross totally owns the music" - Jazz Views
Fiona recently played to some amazing crowds at the legendary Bulls Head and Pizza Express:

images.imgAlt: Fiona Ross - Bulls Head and Pizza Express
Fiona Ross - Bulls Head and Pizza Express
Fiona Ross - Bulls Head and Pizza Express

articleSections.copy:
Next gig is an exclusive intimate evening at Kadies Club in London in July 18th:

https://www.facebook.com/fionarossmusic/videos/334350617496152

Fi has also been busy doing the press circuit, with some radio interviews:

Jazz Talk News: https://www.jazztalk.news/e/fierce-and-non-compliant-the-multi-talented-fiona-ross

Eclectic Radio Show: https://www.mixcloud.com/virginie-puiboube/eclectic-feat-fiona-ross-29th-may-2019/

Fi has also been to Paris where he spent some time in immersing herself in the Parisian Jazz life: https://jazzineurope.mfmmedia.nl/2019/06/theres-something-about-paris/

More news soon!

title: April update

articleSections.copy:
So sorry for the delay in news! We have all been busy and excited about the new release!

April 18th is the launch of Fi’s new album 'Fierce and Non-Compliant' - You can read all about it here: http://www.fionaross.co.uk/music/album/4

Pre orders on the physical CD available through website only. Album will be available on all normal digital platforms from April 18th.
Fi had a great photo shoot with Steve Tiller recently, here’s some shots:

Gigs page is getting busy! Next gig is at the legendary Bulls Head in Barnes for the album launch. Here’s the ticket link:

https://tickets.thebullsheadbarnes.com/events/2019-04-18-fiona-ross-album-launch-fierce-and-non-compliant-bulls-head-barnes

And a video: https://www.facebook.com/fionarossmusic/videos/411346773016655

Fi has also had some great press coming in over the past month, including a video interview for Jazz in Europe which received an incredible amount of views in the first couple of days:

https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=2813840388842069

An article with Indie Music Women: https://indiemusicwomen.com/featured/fiona-ross-fierce-and-non-compliant/

Keep an eye on the press page for all of Fi’s articles.
Fi was honoured to have been nominated for four awards by the International Sing Songwriters Association

title: January update

articleSections.copy:
Happy New year to everyone!

Fi has had a crazy packed start to the year already. First gig of the year at the famous 606 club in London on February 11th. Here’s the link:

https://www.606club.co.uk/events/view/fiona-ross

The big news of course this month is Fi has been in studio recording the new album! Fi is recording at Studio XYZ again, which is where the last two albums were recorded. Do follow Fi on social media for video clips and regular studio footage and album updates. The album cover and title has now been revealed!

Fi had a great time being interviewed by Eamonn Lenihan "Lenihan has created something more than a late night soundscape of the finest music known to humanity; he has created something that is a work of art itself Sunday Independent." Here’s the link:

http://www.nobetterman.com

Amazing new review in this month for Fi’s last album over in Spain: "Fiona Ross is one of those musical phenomena that arise every so many years"

https://lahabitaciondeljazz.blogspot.com/2019/01/fiona-ross-cd-black-white-and-little.html

Fi also had a wonderful interview with Elizabeth Chute chatting about the new album:

https://passionandmeaning.com/latest-news-from-fiona-ross/
More news soon!

title: December update

articleSections.copy:
Fi has had a crazy but exciting month so far.

Fi went to Vienna to record with a special guest for the new album, and the big reveal was…….the grammy nominated artist Snow Owl, is a special guest on two tracks on Fi’s next album. They recorded two songs in a castle in Vienna - the same castle that Snow Owl recorded his last album ‘The Blue Road’. Please do have a look on Fi’s facebook page for more photos and info - including a reveal video.
Fi had lots of fun on the radio and was interviewed and performed two tracks live on the BBC with her guitarist Gibbi Bettini.

Maxine Gordon was in London for the launch of her new book about Dexter Gordon. Fi attended this event, with an article just published on Jazz Quarterly: http://www.stylequarterly.com/entertainment/the-jazz-room-jazz-quarterly-maxine-gordon-brings-her-sophisticated-giant-to-london-by-fiona-ross
articleSections.imgAlt: Fiona Ross at Maxine Gordon's Book Launch

articleSections.copy: Fi performed to a packed house and ended with a standing ovation at Colchester Arts Centre Jazz Club, which was her last gig of the year. Currently booking dates for 2019 for the new album tour. Keep an eye on the gigs page for announcements - first gig of the year at the 606 club in London.
articleSections.imgAlt: Fiona Ross at Colchester Arts Centre Jazz Club

articleSections.copy: Fi would like to thank you all for your support and wish you a wonderful Christmas holiday time

title: November update

articleSections.copy: Two of Fi’s articles have been included in the Winter edition of the new Jazz in Europe magazine. Maxine Gordon and Eric Bibb. Available here: https://jazzineurope.mfmmedia.nl/2018/10/jazz-in-europe-magazine-winter-2018/
The new album is full steam ahead and the first recording session is this month, with a very special guest. All to be revealed soon!
Fi is excited to be on BBC Radio on November 28th - further details to follow. She will be performing a few songs live on air and chatting about all things!

Next gig is at the Colchester Arts Centre Jazz Club on December 2nd.

https://www.colchesterartscentre.com/events/jazz/fiona-ross-sextet-special-guest-marco-piccioni

title: October update
bodyMain:
Lots of exciting things happening at the moment. Fi is busy writing the next album and starts recording next month, with some very special guests, which will be announced soon. Planned album release in April 2019.

Fi has been honoured to interview some inspirational women as part of her Women in Jazz series for Jazz in Europe – Maxine Gordon, Roseanna Vitro, Terri Lyn Carrington – with some more incredible women coming up soon. https://jazzineurope.mfmmedia.nl/category/fiona-ross-women-in-jazz/

New video is coming out soon for the title track for recent album ‘Black, White and a Little Bit of Grey’. Lots of fun was had filming in Greenwich, London with Finnish Director Gugge Wasenius (photo below).

Fi was blown away by the response to her first article for Jazz Quartely - discussing the power of music and our social responsibility as artists with Eric Bibb, Snow Owl and Roseanna Vitro: http://www.stylequarterly.com/entertainment/the-jazz-room-jazz-briefs-the-truth-the-power-behind-the-song-by-fiona-ross

Next gig December 2nd!

title: Fi is thrilled to be part of the Jazz Quarterly and Style Quarterly team now
bodyMain: Just announced! http://www.stylequarterly.com/entertainment/style-quarterly-proudly-welcomes-the-fabulous-fiona-ross

title: Fi’s last gig at Toulouse Lautrec was packed out, had an amazing time
Fi featured on the cover of the Colchester Jazz Club magazine
Fi is honoured to have a new series on Women in Jazz for Jazz in Europe
Fi has a Facebook Live interview with Darrell Craig Harris for 'For the Love of Bass, Guitar and Music'
bodyMain: Here’s the link: https://www.facebook.com/bassandguitarlove/videos/1362559087176893

title: Insomniac Club Patron
bodyMain: Fi is extremely honoured to announce she is now the Patron for https://www.insomniacclub.co.uk. A wonderful organization passionate about managing mental health creatively.

title: Fi’s gig at The Pheasantry, Pizza Express was an amazing, packed out evening. Everyone had a great night!
Fi is honoured to have been asked to be a judge for the 2018 Virtual Jazz Club
bodyMain:
The organization is a non-profit all volunteer association dedicated to support jazz music in all its forms around the world. More info to follow!

http://7virtualjazzclub.net/en/judges/fiona-ross-uk/

title: Fi announces album release date
Fi had a wonderful interview with amazing JazzBitesRadio.com
bodyMain:
Here’s what they said about Fi:

  • "A powerhouse of vocal talent hidden behind a glamorous exterior"

  • "An artist with an incredible degree of stage presence, formidable artistic training, and distinctive vocal prowess who has the ability to knock an audience sideways"

Link to interview: http://jazzigators-jazzbites.blogspot.co.uk/2017/09/p-f-image-fionaross.html

title: The next album is now all recorded and mixed
bodyMain: Keep checking for release date which will be announced soon! Album was recorded at XYZ Studios and mixed at Highfield Studio. Mastering next!

title: The Jazz UK Album of the week
bodyMain: Fi was absolutely thrilled to have her album ‘Just Me (and sometimes someone else) selected and featured as album of the week on The Jazz UK. Tracks were played from the album throughout the week and the response has been overwhelming!

Exclusive set at Arch 1 on the 30th September!

bodyMain:
Fi’s music is currently being played on 12 stations worldwide. Very excited to have some new radio stations playing tracks from both of Fi’s albums:

http://turnitupbigtime.com

title: Great new article has just been published on londonjazznews.com
bodyMain:
• "A galloping enthusiasm and thirst for adventure about Ross"

  • "Her songs have an easy melodic intimacy that leap off the page"

  • "A major burst of creativity"

http://www.londonjazznews.com/2017/07/feature-interview-fiona-ross-new-album.html

title: New Review by Jazz in Europe
bodyMain:
Fi is truly thrilled by the amazing new review of her album by http://www.jazzineurope.com which has already had nearly 3000 views!

‘It’s a bold statement from a bold woman who’s ready to set the world on the fire’

bodyMain:

title: London Jazz Platform
bodyMain:
Fi recently performed at the London Jazz Platform event at London Fields. It was an amazing event and Fi was so honoured to be part of it. Audience response was amazing:

  • "Stunning set, especially the high A you got – incredible" - Sammy Stein

  • "You are an exceptional singer/pianist" - Marco Marconi

  • "Love your music" - Meridian FM Jazz

  • ‘We wanted to hear more!!!’ - Group of people in the audience (!)

title: Fiona Ross Letter To Passionate Kids
bodyMain:
Fi was extremely honoured and humbled to be asked to be involved in this wonderful website that works to inspire young people realise their dreams and stay motivated. They do this initially by interviewing engineers, scientists and musicians and they also support and encourage more girls to get involved in engineering. Fi is referred to as 'London's Royalty of Jazz'. Here is the first published article from Fi.

http://www.instantwebsetup.com/en/successskunks/Fiona_Ross_Letter_to_Passionate_Kids_p4837.html

title: London Jazz Platform
bodyMain:
Very excited to announce that Fi will be doing a set at the London Jazz Platform event on June 18th. The line up is amazing and Fi is thrilled to be included.

http://jazzineurope.mfmmedia.nl/2017/05/the-london-jazz-platform-is-a-new-event-for-london/

title: Jazz Voices
bodyMain: Fi has now been included on jazzvoices.org/gallery which features 'Premier Jazz vocalists'. She is truly humbled to be included on the same page as one of her heroes Dee Dee Bridgewater.

title: Featured on the Daily Express
bodyMain: "Meet the jazz artist who gave Ed Sheeran his 'first push' into music... " Full article

title: Album launch
bodyMain: Great fun at the album launch!

title: Fiona was interviewed live on air at Quest 915 FM talking about the new album.
bodyMain:
Presenter Atsenuwa Omatseye said 'Fiona showed up, spoke....laughed and lit up the jazzville show and was truly 'FIOMINAL'

http://www.questfm.com.ng

title: First gig date in London released for Fiona
bodyMain: May 6th – Hope to see lots of you there!

title: Nate Williams touring
bodyMain: Were very excited to announce that Nate Williams who we are thrilled played Bass and mixed the new album, has just announced he will be touring with Jamiroquai!!

title: New Behind the scenes video released
I Don’t Want To Play
bodyMain: Final shoot for the video for ‘I Don’t Want To Play’ has now taken place and the video is being editing ready for release on April 7th. With a shoot in Spain and two in London, we are all very excited to see the final product! Hope you do too! Remember to subscribe to the new YouTube channel, so you can see it first!!
